"J. B. Rainsberger" wrote:

> Alan, thank you for making this very important point -- one which I
> missed expressing, but which generally governs how I have worked with
> inherited code. Kent, Ron et al have always suggested this technique
> for dealing with inherited code: As you find bugs, write tests that
> expose the bugs, then fix the bugs.As you need to refactor, write
> tests to help provide the safety net during refactoring, then
> refactor.As you need to understand, write tests to codify your
> understanding.

Here's another one I really like:

Before using a method of an untested (third-party or legacy) API, write
tests to understand how it works.


Mike
